medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain with associated fevers and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began 3 days ago with acute onset of epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain radiating to the back. The pain is described as 'irritable' colicky and worsens with eating. Patient reports decreased appetite, bloating, and nausea, with one episode of vomiting this morning. There are no significant changes in bowel habits, though the patient feels constipated.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Severe GERD, gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, seasonal allergies.
medical_history.family_history: No history of gallbladder or liver disease. No history of GI malignancy.
